1.description: Install updates for operating systems, software, and firmware as soon as they are released.

2.description: Require phishing-resistant multi-factor authentication (MFA) for as many services as possible.

3.description: Train users to recognize and report phishing attempts.

4.description: Secure remote access software by applying mitigations from the joint Guide to Securing Remote Access Software.

5.description: Make backups of critical systems and device configurations to enable devices to be repaired and restored.

6.description: Apply mitigations from the joint #StopRansomware Guide.

7.description: Identify and understand all relationships or interdependencies, functionality of each asset, what it exposes, and what software is running to ensure critical data and systems are protected appropriately.

8.description: Install modern anti-malware software and automatically update signatures where possible.

9.description: Validate the URL of the link matches the text of the link itself by hovering your cursor over the link to view the URL of the website to be accessed.

10.description: Prioritize phishing-resistant MFA on accounts with the highest risk, such as privileged administrative accounts on key assets.

11.description: Evaluate and prioritize vulnerabilities to appropriately deal with the posed risks according to your organization’s risk strategy.

12.description: Exercise, test, and validate your organization’s security program against the threat behaviors mapped to the MITRE ATT&CK for Enterprise framework.
